docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of the `DefaultHttpUrlGenerator` class

members.docComment:
/**
 * Create the path to a multiple entity (collection) resource
 *
 * @param entityName - Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'
 *
 * @param root - Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`
 *
 * @returns complete path to resource, e.g, 'some-api/heroes'
 */
members.name: collectionResource

docs.summary: Create the path to a multiple entity (collection) resource

params.name: entityName
params.description: Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'

params.name: root
params.description: Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`

members.docComment:
/**
 * Create the path to a single entity resource
 *
 * @param entityName - Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'
 *
 * @param root - Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`
 *
 * @returns complete path to resource, e.g, 'some-api/hero'
 */
members.name: entityResource

docs.summary: Create the path to a single entity resource

params.name: entityName
params.description: Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'

params.name: root
params.description: Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get or generate the entity and collection resource URLs for the given entity type name
 *
 * @param entityName - Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'
 *
 * @param root - Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`
 */
members.name: getResourceUrls

docs.summary: Get or generate the entity and collection resource URLs for the given entity type name

params.name: entityName
params.description: Name of the entity type, e.g, 'Hero'

params.name: root
params.description: Root path to the resource, e.g., 'some-api`

members.name: knownHttpResourceUrls

docs.summary: Known single-entity and collection resource URLs for HTTP calls. Generator methods returns these resource URLs for a given entity type name. If the resources for an entity type name are not know, it generates and caches a resource name for future use

members.docComment:
/**
 * Register known single-entity and collection resource URLs for HTTP calls
 *
 * @param entityHttpResourceUrls - resource urls for specific entity type names Well-formed resource urls end in a '/'; Note: this method does not ensure that resource urls are well-formed.
 */
members.name: registerHttpResourceUrls

docs.summary: Register known single-entity and collection resource URLs for HTTP calls

params.name: entityHttpResourceUrls
params.description: resource urls for specific entity type names Well-formed resource urls end in a '/'; Note: this method does not ensure that resource urls are well-formed.
